Tam Anh General Hospital in Ho Chi Minh City brings together doctors specializing in Endocrinology - Diabetes who are experienced, skilled, and dedicated to caring for each case. In particular, doctors who have worked at leading hospitals in Vietnam. With in-depth medical knowledge and extensive practical experience, the doctor will recognize suspicious signs and prescribe the patient for diagnostic tests. For example, the patient's blood is taken for a fasting plasma glucose test and fasting for at least 8 hours before the test.
Regular health checks help detect prediabetes early, allowing for timely treatment.
If the blood sugar test result is less than 100 mg/dL, it is normal. (5)
If your blood sugar is 126 mg/dL or higher, you have diabetes. At this time, you will continue to check your blood sugar with an oral glucose tolerance test. After testing your fasting blood sugar, you are given a sugar solution to drink.
After 2 hours, medical staff will take blood for further testing (also known as any blood sugar test, post-meal blood sugar test).
If blood sugar is below 140 mg/dL, it is normal.; If your blood sugar is between 140 and 199mg/dL, you have prediabetes; If your blood sugar is 200 mg/dL or higher, you have diabetes.
In addition, you will have an HbA1C test. This is a blood test that shows the average blood sugar level over the past 3 months, often used to check whether a patient has good blood sugar control or not. HbA1C is also used to diagnose prediabetes.
If HbA1C is below 5.6%, it is normal.
– If HbA1C is from 5.7 to 6.4%, it is prediabetes.
– If HbA1C is 6.5% or higher, you have diabetes.
Your doctor may ask you to test your blood sugar again to confirm.
Children are also at risk of prediabetes. According to the American Diabetes Association, children aged 10 years and older who fall into the following cases should have their blood sugar checked periodically to detect pre-diabetes early and prevent it promptly. Specifically:
Overweight, obese; Having a family member with type 2 diabetes; The child's mother had gestational diabetes during pregnancy.
If a child at high risk for prediabetes has normal blood sugar results, the American Diabetes Association recommends retesting at least every 3 years.
